comments: This is the primary (surrogate) key linking the record to obs_general.
This is the secondary key linking the record to obs_general.

definition: The PDS4 bundle or PDS3 volume containing the observation. PDS4 bundles are semantically-meaningful constructs used to group similar observations; the bundle name is descriptive and part of the LID for each included data product. PDS3 volumes are artificial constructs used to group consecutive observations into manageable chunks. They are formatted as MMIII_NNNN, where MMIII is an abbreviation for the mission and instrument (e.g. COISS for Cassini Orbiter ISS) and NNNN is a four-digit volume number. Hubble volumes have 5-digit volume numbers and are formatted as HSTIN_NNNN. See Bundles/Volumes under Help for the list of bundles and volumes available in OPUS.

comments: The instrument_id is included here for ease of database manipulation only.

definition: A string assigned by the PDS describing a PDS3 data set. Data sets are often aggregations of multiple volumes. A Data Set ID usually encodes, at a minimum, the mission, instrument, and version number of the data as provided by the instrument team.
A permanent identifier assigned to a PDS3 data product by the PDS that is unique within its data set.

A Logical IDentifier assigned to a PDS4 data product. While each individual data product has its own LID, the LID used here is the one identified by OPUS as the primary data product. If searching by LID, it may be most productive to perform a partial string search on the LID prefix.
The approximate date and time when the PDS data product was created for inclusion in the archive. Although many formats are supported, the standard is YYYY-MM-DD[Thh:mm:ss.sss].
definition_results: The approximate date and time when the PDS data product was created for inclusion in the archive.
pi_intro: The Product Creation Time is the time when the actual final data product was created for inclusion in the PDS archive, not the time of the original observation. In most cases, you will want to use the Observation Time under General Constraints instead.

definition: The full primary data product filename, including the path, relative to its containing bundle/volume in the PDS archive.
pi_intro: The Primary File Spec uses different filename extensions depending on the mission and instrument, and in many cases specifies the label file instead of the data file. Thus we suggest that you do not include the extension in your search and that you use the "contains" query type to guarantee the best match.

definition: Miscellaneous notes or comments about an observation, such as why the observation was taken or known problems with the data.
